name: omit
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
C1 to fail to include or do something: She was omitted from the list of contributors to the report. The Prince's tour conveniently omitted the most deprived areas of the city. [ + to infinitive ] formal She omitted to mention that she would be away next week.
More examplesFewer examplesI've bracketed the bits of text that could be omitted.The book omitted any mention of the king's illness.She omitted to inform the authorities of their visit.

to fail to include or do something: I’d be upset if my name were omitted from the list of contributors. omission noun [ C/U ] us

/oʊˈmɪʃ·ən/
[ U ] Parents are upset by the omission of music from the school’s courses.
